Module JavaDataStructures
Package JavaDS.Sorters

Class QuickSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • JavaDS.Sorters.SuperSort<T>
      • JavaDS.Sorters.QuickSort<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of data elements being sorted.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISorter<T>
    public class QuickSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends SuperSort<T>
implements ISorter<T>
    Class implementing the Quick Sort algorithm. Can sort a provided collection of Comparable extending data elements in average O(n log(n)) time complexity.
    Author:
    Tom Esser

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuickSort

        public QuickSort​(java.util.AbstractList<T> unsortedData)
        Constructor accepting an initial collection of data elements to be sorted formatted as an AbstractList. Uses the median as pivot location in partitioning, unless specified in constructor.
        Parameters:
        unsortedData - The collection of data elements to be stored for sorting.

      • QuickSort

        public QuickSort​(T[] unsortedData)
        Constructor accepting an initial collection of data elements to be sorted formatted as an Array. Uses the median as pivot location in partitioning, unless specified in constructor.
        Parameters:
        unsortedData - The collection of data elements to be stored for sorting.

      • QuickSort

        public QuickSort​(java.util.AbstractList<T> unsortedData,
                 SortPivot pivotOption)
        Constructor accepting an initial collection of data elements to be sorted formatted as an AbstractList.
        Parameters:
        unsortedData - The collection of data elements to be stored for sorting.
        pivotOption - Where to pick for pivot location in partitioning in Quick Sort algorithm. If no value is provided, the median element is used.

      • QuickSort

        public QuickSort​(T[] unsortedData,
                 SortPivot pivotOption)
        Constructor accepting an initial collection of data elements to be sorted formatted as an Array.
        Parameters:
        unsortedData - The collection of data elements to be stored for sorting.
        pivotOption - Where to pick for pivot location in partitioning in Quick Sort algorithm. If no value is provided, the median element is used.

    • Method Detail

      • Sort

        public void Sort​(SortDirection dir)
        Method to sort the data collection stored within the class using the Quick Sort sorting algorithm.
        Specified by:
        Sort in interface ISorter<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
        Specified by:
        Sort in class SuperSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which to sort the data collection.

      • DoSort

        private void DoSort​(SortDirection dir,
                    int low,
                    int high)
        Method that sorts using the Quick Sort algorithm with recursive partitioning.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction the collection is being sorted in.
        low - The effective low element in the collection.
        high - The effective high element in the collection.

      • Partition

        private int Partition​(SortDirection dir,
                      int low,
                      int high)
        Method to choose pivot and place in correct location.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction the collection is being sorted in.
        low - The effective low element in the collection.
        high - The effective high element in the collection.
        Returns:
        The next pivot.
